text:
Hey, team) :spock-hand:
I’m from PandaDoc, and we are working on upgrading our HubSpot UI extension.
One of the missing possibilities for us is installing our private packages to the extension. As for example, we want to analyse and log extension errors to Sentry. We have our own lib with the Sentry wrapper. We store this on JFrog. To install it we need to visit JFrog storage with the private token. The issue is that we don’t control the build and deploy process of the extension. It happens on HubSpot’s side. Therefore we need to somehow get this token during the build process. Sending it directly with the app doesn’t look secure.
Do you have any suggestions of how we can solve this problem? Maybe there is some sort of realisation of env variables, or we can set up this key securely in the account?
hi everyone, I have a question is there a way to open a new tab pragmatically in extension UI?
<@U07LUDQMPEE> is actively looking into Sentry integrations. I think she will be able to help here.
Jeff, where/what would you want to open a new tab? An external link?

Hey all, I'm seeing a ton of interest in the settings space, so want to make sure you've seen this new product update (In development stage): <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/product-updates//all?query=settings&update=13969243>
There is also a feedback form in the update.

Hi Benoit,

Thanks for reaching out about `associatedObjectProperties`. This property doesn’t have any functionality and shouldn’t have been included in our documentation. It’s been deprecated and will be removed from the docs soon to avoid further confusion.

Sorry for the confusing and thanks for bringing it up :bow:

As for private package installation, we do not have support for that. We have secrets in serverless functions and have investigated some runtime options, but none for build time. How often does your team use private packages? Any extra details here to assess needs and potential work arounds would be great!

Hi Team,  I need access to HS UI Extension for Public App card Feature  development for these 2 Test Account :
*48690960*
*48961799*
In the document it said it does not require beta but its still failing. This is a bit urgent so if someone could look into it soon, that will be very much appreciated !

The document says “_Developers with access to Sales or Service Hub Enterprise can now use CRM development tools to build UI extensions (custom cards) based on a new technology stack with React as frontend. These extensions can be displayed on the middle column tab or the sidebar of the record page_.” - *Does that mean a developer cannot develop this UI extension public app in a Free tier  ? Also client who do not have Enterprise account cannot install this app from marketplace  ?*

Secondly, I also came across this article below which talks about developing public app card which seems to be in free tier so  I am confused as which one should be used to generate a “Public app card”?
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/install-and-manage-app-cards>

CC: <@U03FJQPSC0Y>  Appreciate any guidance here if possible

*Also a separate follow up question* : I am getting a CORS error ( Security policy Error) when trying to click a submit button in a public app that takes user to a external public webhook URL. Any idea how to overcome that ?
